summary: This document is a Bureau of Prisons Form 583 Report of Incident and associated staff memoranda detailing the events of July 23, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It reports a possible suicide attempt by inmate Jeffrey Epstein, who was found with an orange cloth around his neck. The report includes conflicting accounts from Epstein and his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, with Epstein later alleging that Tartaglione tried to kill him and extort money. This document contains Bureau of Prisons medical and incident reports detailing Jeffrey Epstein's apparent suicide attempt in his cell on July 23, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It includes a clinical encounter describing his injuries, photo sheets documenting the incident, an administrative detention order, an incident report, and a medical report for his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary inmate involved in the reported incident. Found with an orange cloth around his neck, initially treated as a suicide attempt. Later alleged his cellmate tried to kill and extort him.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate in the Special Housing Unit. Reported the incident to staff, stating Epstein attempted to hang himself. Later accused by Epstein of attempted murder and extortion.

persons.name: C076
persons.context: The staff member who submitted the initial Form 583 Report of Incident.

persons.name: MLP
persons.context: Medical staff who examined and treated Jeffrey Epstein for a circular line of erythema on his neck after the incident.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the documents; found in his cell with a rope around his neck on July 23, 2019, and treated for injuries. He was on suicide watch.

persons.name: Nicholas John Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate at the time of the incident; reported the hanging attempt to staff and was later medically evaluated.

persons.name: Lieutenant
persons.context: Staff member who authored the administrative detention order and was involved in the photo documentation of the incident scene.

persons.name: PA-C
persons.context: Medical provider who evaluated cellmate Nicholas Tartaglione on July 31, 2019, noting he had no complaints or injuries.

persons.name: Kang, Yoon PAC
persons.context: Provider listed as completing the medical encounter documentation for Nicholas Tartaglione.

connections.description: Were housed together in cell Z05-124LAD in the Special Housing Unit (SHU). Epstein later accused Tartaglione of attempted murder and extortion.
MLP provided medical examination and treatment to Epstein for injuries related to the incident.
Were housed together in the Special Housing Unit cell 124 at the time of Epstein's apparent suicide attempt.
Correctional supervisor who ordered Epstein's administrative detention and whose office documented the incident.
Medical provider who assessed and treated Epstein's injuries following the incident.
Medical provider who evaluated Tartaglione days after the incident.

events.title: Possible Suicide Attempt / Incident in SHU
events.description: At approximately 1:27 AM, a call for assistance was announced in the Special Housing Unit. Jeffrey Epstein was found lying on his cell floor with an orange homemade cloth/rope around his neck, breathing heavily and snoring. He was unresponsive to initial calls.

events.title: Epstein's Allegations Against Cellmate
events.description: After becoming responsive, Epstein alleged to staff that his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, had tried to kill him and had been harassing and attempting to extort money from him for a week. He claimed Tartaglione said staff wouldn't care if he was hurt.

events.title: Medical Examination
events.description: Epstein was examined by MLP and found to have a circular line of erythema at the base of his neck with marks of friction, and a small erythema on his left knee.

events.title: Epstein Apparent Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his Special Housing Unit cell with a homemade orange rope around his neck, sitting on the floor. His cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, alerted staff. Epstein was breathing but unresponsive when found.

events.title: Epstein Placed in Administrative Detention
events.description: Epstein was ordered into Administrative Detention at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, pending classification, due to a perceived threat to safety and institutional security.

events.title: Tartaglione Medical Evaluation
events.description: Nicholas Tartaglione was evaluated by a PA-C in the Special Housing Unit. He reported feeling well, denied any involvement or injury related to the incident with his former cellmate Epstein.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
Special Housing Unit (SHU), 9 SOUTH, Cell Z05-124LAD
Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, N.Y.
keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, at 1:27 AM, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his SHU cell with an orange homemade cloth around his neck, appearing unresponsive but breathing and snoring.
Epstein's cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, initially reported the incident, stating he found Epstein with a string around his neck.

After being placed on suicide watch, Epstein became responsive and alleged that Tartaglione had tried to kill him and had been extorting him, claiming Tartaglione said staff would not report any assault due to Epstein's charges.
Medical examination revealed a circular red line with friction marks on Epstein's neck, consistent with the reported ligature.
The document is a formal Bureau of Prisons incident report (Form 583) and includes multiple staff memoranda, indicating an official record of the event preceding Epstein's death.
Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell on July 23, 2019, at approximately 1:27 AM with a homemade orange rope around his neck, in what was documented as a possible suicide attempt.

Epstein had a circular line of erythema (redness) around the base of his neck, approximately 2 inches wide, sparing the back. He was ambulatory, oriented, smiling, and denied knowing how the marks occurred.
Epstein's cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, was the one who alerted staff to the incident, stating Epstein had attempted to hang himself.
Epstein had been placed in Administrative Detention on July 10, 2019, for his own protection and pending classification.
Medical staff placed Epstein on suicide watch following the incident.
